snippet: The companies’ former corporate parent sought to push down the price of the grain and reaped $5.4 million in illicit profits, the regulator said.
abstract: Commodity Futures Trading Commission sues Kraft Foods Group and former corporate parent Mondelez over illicit trades of wheat futures as well as other violations of commodity trading rules; suit comes less than week after Kraft was sold to H J Heinz.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The companies’ former corporate parent sought to push down the price of the grain and reaped $5.4 million in illicit profits, the regulator said.

headline.main: C.F.T.C. Accuses Kraft and Mondelez of Manipulating Wheat Prices
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Two Food Companies Accused of Manipulating Wheat Prices
